com.att.research.xacml.api

Interface RequestAttributes

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AttributeCategory
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StdMutableRequestAttributes, StdRequestAttributes

    public interface RequestAttributes
extends AttributeCategory
    Defines the API for objects that represent XACML 3.0 Attributes elements within a Request by extending the AttributeCategory interface with methods for accessing DOM Nodes representing XACML 3.0 Content elements.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    Christopher A. Rath

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Implementations of the RequestAttributes interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two RequestAttributes objects (r1 and r2) are equal if: r1.super.equals(r2) AND r1.getContentRoot() == null && r2.getContentRoot() == null OR r1.getContentRoot().equals(r2.getContentRoot()) AND r1.getXmlId() == null && r2.getXmlId() == null OR r1.getXmlId().equals(r2.getXmlId())
      org.w3c.dom.Node getContentNodeByXpathExpression(javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpression xpathExpression)
      Finds the Node referenced by the given XPathExpression within the XACML Content element in this RequestAttributes object.
      org.w3c.dom.NodeList getContentNodeListByXpathExpression(javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpression xpathExpression)
      Finds the NodeList referenced by the given XPathExpression within the XACML Content element in this RequestAttributes object.
      org.w3c.dom.Node getContentRoot()
      Gets the root Node from the XACML 3.0 Content element of an Attributes element in a Request.
      java.lang.String getXmlId()
      Returns the String representing the xml:Id attribute for the XACML Attributes element represented by this RequestAttributes object.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.att.research.xacml.api.AttributeCategory

        getAttributes, getAttributes, getCategory, hasAttributes

    • Method Detail

      • getContentRoot

        org.w3c.dom.Node getContentRoot()
        Gets the root Node from the XACML 3.0 Content element of an Attributes element in a Request.
        Returns:
        the root Node from the XACML 3.0 Content element of an Attributes element in a Request.

      • getContentNodeByXpathExpression

        org.w3c.dom.Node getContentNodeByXpathExpression(javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpression xpathExpression)
        Finds the Node referenced by the given XPathExpression within the XACML Content element in this RequestAttributes object.
        Parameters:
        xpathExpression - the XPathExpression to apply to the Content element.
        Returns:
        the Node returned by the given XPathExpression or null if not found.

      • getContentNodeListByXpathExpression

        org.w3c.dom.NodeList getContentNodeListByXpathExpression(javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpression xpathExpression)
        Finds the NodeList referenced by the given XPathExpression within the XACML Content element in this RequestAttributes object.
        Parameters:
        xpathExpression - the XPathExpression to apply to the Content element.
        Returns:
        the NodeList containing all Nodes that match the XPathExpression

      • getXmlId

        java.lang.String getXmlId()
        Returns the String representing the xml:Id attribute for the XACML Attributes element represented by this RequestAttributes object.
        Returns:
        the String representing the xml:Id attribute for the XACML Attributes element represented by this RequestAttributes object. May be null.

      • equals

        boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Implementations of the RequestAttributes interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two RequestAttributes objects (r1 and r2) are equal if: r1.super.equals(r2) AND r1.getContentRoot() == null && r2.getContentRoot() == null OR r1.getContentRoot().equals(r2.getContentRoot()) AND r1.getXmlId() == null && r2.getXmlId() == null OR r1.getXmlId().equals(r2.getXmlId())
        Specified by:
        equals in interface AttributeCategory
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
